title: Worcester couple sentenced for 18 years in prison for sex trafficking
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Kiersten and Moises Soto sentenced to 18 years for sex trafficking a family member in New England.
The Sotos convicted of sex trafficking by force, fraud, coercion, and promoting unlawful activities across state lines.
They face a $5,000 fine, $138,000 restitution to the victim, and five years of supervised release.

title: The rumors are true: A new Kowloon location is on the way
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Kowloon restaurant is opening a new location on Revere Beach with a unique 'Kowloon Tiki on the Beach' theme.
The original Kowloon in Saugus, a Greater Boston staple since 1950, is undergoing its first major expansion.
The new Kowloon location is set to open this spring, with details confirmed by a restaurant representative.

title: Weymouth company creates 180-foot long Pats logo on ice ahead of Super Bowl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Weymouth's 3A Gear created a 180-foot Patriots logo on frozen Back River ahead of the Super Bowl.
The massive logo was designed using land surveying equipment and food coloring sprayed on ice.
The river's rare freezing allowed the project, reminiscent of a similar 2004 endeavor by the owner's father.

title: NFL insider: Maxx Crosby wants to play for Mike Vrabel, Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: NFL insider reports Maxx Crosby wants to play for Patriots under Mike Vrabel.
Crosby, tied to the Raiders until 2029, has a $35.8 million cap hit next season.
New England is an attractive location for NFL players, bolstered by quarterback Drake Maye's presence.

title: Patriots get good news about Drake Mayeâ€™s shoulder in new injury report
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye was a full participant in Wednesday's practice after a shoulder injury scare.
Drake Maye injured his shoulder during the AFC Championship game against Denver but reports feeling 100% for the Super Bowl.
Linebacker Robert Spillane missed Wednesday's practice due to an ankle injury sustained in the AFC title game.

title: Comparing code readers and scan tools
author: John Paul
bullets: Code readers read generic codes and clear the check engine light, while scan tools access more systems and manufacturer codes.
Scan tools, such as the Harbor Freight T-10, offer bi-directional testing and rival more expensive tools in functionality.
Toyota's remote start feature shuts off the engine when the driver's door is opened, a built-in safety measure.

title: Gloucester nonprofit launches support fund for Lily Jean crew member families
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Lily Jean Fund launched to support families of seven crew members presumed dead after their boat sank near Cape Ann.
Donations to the Lily Jean Fund are tax-deductible, with an initial $40,000 to be matched by an anonymous donor.
The Gloucester Fishing Community Preservation Fund and Cape Ann Savings Bank facilitate the fund to distribute proceeds to crew families.

title: Red Sox reportedly sign infielder Isiah Kiner-Falefa to 1-year contract
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox signed infielder Isiah Kiner-Falefa to a 1-year contract to enhance their infield defense.
Kiner-Falefa, 30, played 138 games in 2025 with the Pirates and Blue Jays, performing at shortstop, third, and second base.
The Red Sox need infield depth after missing out on free agents Alex Bregman and Bo Bichette.

title: Vince Wilfork calls out Tom Brady for not picking Patriots to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Vince Wilfork criticized Tom Brady for not explicitly supporting the Patriots in Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Tom Brady said he didn't have a preference for Super Bowl LX, praising the Patriots' new era under Mike Vrabel.
Rob Gronkowski confirmed his support for the Patriots, countering Brady's noncommittal stance on the upcoming game.

title: When did Mike Vrabel, Stefon Diggs realize Drake Maye was going to be special?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel knew Drake Maye was special before joining the Patriots, praising his athletic play style and pocket presence.
Drake Maye's second year with the Patriots marked significant progress, including MVP candidacy and a near Super Bowl appearance.
Stefon Diggs recognized Maye's talent during a 2024 game with the Texans, impressed by his passing and athleticism.
